definitions: The chemical element of atomic number 30, a silvery-white metal that is a constituent of brass and is used for coating (galvanizing) iron and steel to protect against corrosion.
Galvanized iron or steel, especially as the material of domestic utensils or corrugated roofs.
Chemical element of symbol Zn, atomic number 30 (30 protons and 30 electrons) with atomic mass 65.4 atomic mass unit.
